article_title: Carolinas Hospital System CEO says aim is to grow, improve services
article_text:
Carolinas Hospital System employs about 1,700 people and is part of Community Health Systems, headquartered in Franklin, Tennessee.

Community Health Systems owns 198 hospitals in 29 states with five others in the Palmetto state:

CHS in Marion, Mary Black Memorial Hospital in Spartanburg, Chester Regional Medical Center, Springs Memorial Hospital in Lancaster and Gaffney Medical Center.

- - -

A publicly traded company, CHS stock was trading at $29.89 a share on Thursday, with a 52-week high of $65 and a 52-week low of $25.36.

- - -

According to CHS’s Nov. 3 SEC filing:

Net operating revenue increased by 1.4 percent to approximately $4.86 billion for the three months ended Sept. 30, 2015, from approximately $4.78 billion for three months ended Sept. 30, 2014.

- - -

In 2014, Carolinas Hospital System saw

41,018 visits to the ER

12,214 admissions

34,259 outpatient visits

- - -

Payroll and benefits in 2014: $108, 412, 810

Capital investments: $18,748,950

Property and sales taxes: $11,071,026

Charity for uncompensated care: $72,988,504

Donations to the community: $56,626

- - -

Sources: Carolinas Hospital System and Community Health Systems

og.description: FLORENCE, S.C. -- Carolinas Hospital System is looking to grow in 2016.
